alert.note: Alert for Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 4:57PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of , the western City of Chesapeake, the southern City of Portsmouth and the east central City of Suffolk through 545 PM EDT... At 457 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Deep Creek. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rain could result in localized ponding of water on roadways. Locations impacted include... Downtown Suffolk, Deep Creek, Chesapeake, Portsmouth, Suffolk, Cradock, Bowers Hill, South Norfolk, Wilroy, Herberts Corner, Magnolia and Chesapeake Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.
